data: Carved across the rear wall of the terrace separating the upper and lower sections of the theatre cavea, text interrupted by  the breaks between the cunei.

Monumental letters without serifs, but with a widening towards the end of terminal strokes. Straight bar alpha; beta with equal loops, closed; epsilon with shorter middle bar; Mu with verical first and last, shorter mid-strokes; omicron consistently smaller and mid-line; rho with closed loop; sigma with slightly open top and bottom strokes, mid-strokes only part width; phi with a small elliptical eye.
In the period subsequent to the establishment of the co-regency of Hieron II and Gelon (i.e. after 241/240 BCE)
In situ in the cunei of the diazoma of the theatre of Hieron II, Siracusa
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag April 2006.
Area archeologica della Neapolis, Orecchio di Dionisio e Teatro Greco
Archaeological park, containing the Greek theatre, altar of Hieron, Roman amphitheatre, and ancient stone quarries.
Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, additis graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae inscriptionibus

G. Kaibel, Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, additis graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae inscriptionibus, Inscriptiones Graecae consilio et auctoritate Academiae Litterarum Regiae Borussicae Editae. Volumen XIV., XIV (Berlin: Georgius Reimerus, 1890)
A. Boeckh et al., Corpus Inscriptionum Graecarum, 4 vols (Berlin: Ex Officina Academica, 1828)
F. Bechtel et al., Sammlung der griechischen Dialekt-Inschriften, 4 vols (Göttingen: Vandenhoeck and Ruprecht, 1884)
Centro e periferia nel regno siracusano di Ierone II
Malcolm Bell, «Centro e periferia nel regno siracusano di Ierone II», in La colonisation grecque en Méditerranée occidentale, CEFR 251 (Rome, Paris, 1999), 257–77
Margherita Guarducci, Epigrafia greca, 4 voll. (Rome: Istituto Poligrafico dello Stato, Libreria dello Stato, 1967)
Per una revisione dei documenti epigrafici siracusani pertinenti al regno di Ierone II

Alessia Dimartino, «Per una revisione dei documenti epigrafici siracusani pertinenti al regno di Ierone II», in Guerra e pace in Sicilia e nel Mediterraneo antico (VIII-III sec. a.C.). Arte, prassi e teoria della pace e della guerra, a c. di C. Michelini, vol. 2, 2 voll., Atti Elimi V (Pisa: Edizioni della Normale, 2006), 703–17
Alessia Dimartino, «Iscrizioni del teatro di Siracusa», Axon 1,1, fasc. 103 (2017): 267–76, https://doi.org/10.14277/2532-6848/Axon-1-1-17-25
W. Dittenberger, Sylloge inscriptionum graecarum, 3rd edn, 3 vols (Leipzig: S. Hirzelium, 1915)
Syrakus unter Agathokles und Hieron II
C. Lehmler, Syrakus unter Agathokles und Hieron II (Frankfurt am Main: Verlag Antike, 2005)
Jonathan Prag revised from autopsy notes and added images
Bell, 1999, Centro e periferia nel regno siracusano di Ierone II
Dimartino, 2006, Per una revisione dei documenti epigrafici siracusani pertinenti al regno di Ierone II
Dimartino, 2017, Iscrizioni del teatro di Siracusa
Lehmler, 2005, Syrakus unter Agathokles und Hieron II

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text based on autopsy (2006), except for cuneus 7 (text of Dimartino 2017)

English translation

Jonathan Prag

[Of King Gelon]; of Queen Nereis; of Queen Philistis; of King Hieron; of Zeus Olympios; [----]; of Herakles the stout-hearted; [----]; [----]

commentary

The reading of cuneus 7 is generally agreed, although the visibility of the individual letters varies from one edition to the next. The missing divine names in 6, 8 and 9 are commonly suggested to be Hera, Kore and Demeter.

Carved across the rear wall of the terrace separating the upper and lower sections of the theatre cavea, text interrupted by the breaks between the cunei.

limestone wall chiselled

Monumental letters without serifs, but with a widening towards the end of terminal strokes. Straight bar alpha; beta with equal loops, closed; epsilon with shorter middle bar; Mu with verical first and last, shorter mid-strokes; omicron consistently smaller and mid-line; rho with closed loop; sigma with slightly open top and bottom strokes, mid-strokes only part width; phi with a small elliptical eye.

Line 1-9 130-170 (but omicron 90-110) Interlineation line 1 to 2 Syracusae Siracusa 37.08415, 15.27628 In the period subsequent to the establishment of the co-regency of Hieron II and Gelon (i.e. after 241/240 BCE) In situ in the cunei of the diazoma of the theatre of Hieron II, Siracusa37.075999, 15.275032 Prag, April 2006
